review: I was torn between buying the Fire Stick or Roku. I bought the Fire Stick because I could get a free Roku Stick with my Sling TV subscription. I love Amazon products and their whole shebang but the Stick seems to be lacking. There should me more apps available than what they have. I know I have to mess around with it some more, but for 40 bucks I am not impressed.
author: Bryon

review: I haven't been able to use the Stick fully yet because I bought it under the impression that it would work on a public WiFi network, aka a university connection.  Amazon doesn't provide enough documentation to accurately inform the buyer what type of networks it does and does not work on.  Bottom line, I am currently on a WPA2 - Enterprise network which is one which is public but requires a personal login and password and the Fire TV Stick is not compatable.  Although this is not the only reason I bought the device, its unfortunate and should be noted that sometimes you can't get the full benefit unless you are on your personal WiFi or on a truly public WiFi (no usernames required.)
author: Eric Sciorilli
